intro: Hartogia ambigua, commonly known as the narrow-leaved daisy, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features narrow, linear leaves and produces small, white to pale yellow flowers that bloom in spring. It is typically found in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun. Hartogia ambigua is often used in gardens for its ornamental value and drought tolerance.
